name: getArtifactMetaDataByGlobalId
description:
Gets the metadata for an artifact version in the registry using its globally unique
identifier.  The returned metadata includes both generated (read-only) and editable
metadata (such as name and description).

This operation may fail for one of the following reasons:

* No artifact version with this `globalId` exists (HTTP error `404`)
* A server error occurred (HTTP error `500`)

globalId.description: Global identifier for an artifact version.

$ul: **properties**: User-defined name-value pairs. Name and value must be strings.
**state**: Describes the state of an artifact or artifact version.  The following states

$block:
All error responses, whether `4xx` or `5xx` will include one of these as the response
body.

$ul: **detail**: Full details about the error.  This might contain a server stack trace, for example.
